question: She ___ her pet cat with expensive foods such as smoked salmon.
Over breakfast, he ___ a copy of the local newpaper.
Her persistent complaints began to ___ many of her coworkers.
The professor accused the student of ___ an essay from the Internet.
We stood on the shore and watched the seagulls ___ toward the sea in search of fish.
Critics said the comedian just ___ old jokes for his new show.
A tiny chip was ___ in the animal so that they could track it.
Children in Catholic schools are ___ in Catholic beliefs.

I asked her to ___ me as to what happened during my absence.
